newsitem.title: USA: Shelby Williams backlog rises 20 percent.
newsitem.headline: Shelby Williams backlog rises 20 percent.

text.p: Shelby Williams Industries Inc said Wednesday its backlog of unshipped orders at September 30 was $35.1 million, up 20 percent over last year.

"Continued strong demand for our products, coupled with ongoing efficiency improvements, have driven our earnings and profitability growth," Paul Steinfeld, chairman, said in a statement. "Our focus on our core markets leaves us well-positioned to take advantage of the continued strong demand in the industry."
Earlier, Shelby Williams, which makes contract seating, reported third quarter earnings of $0.25 a share, up from $0.21 a year ago.
The company said its gross margin in the quarter continued to improve to 22.9 percent from 22.1 percent a year ago. The operating margin increased to eight percent from 6.8 percent.
